data.text: This booklet* contains your private health information. Please keep it safe.
Use the Quick Reference guide in this booklet* for quick access.
Carry your Global Health Passport* with you at all times when you travel.
A separate Global Health Passport* is recommended for each individual traveler, including infants and children.
Affix a passport photo below to help medical personnel with individual identification.
© 2020 Global Health Passport, LLC. All rights reserved.

Although this form is detailed, it is neither a comprehensive nor an exhaustive listing of all possible pre-existing or current medical or dental conditions, or potential medical or dental clinical emergencies which patients may encounter and present with in a healthcare setting.

The ultimate responsibility for conveying an accurate and a complete medical history and accurate and complete patient symptoms to healthcare personnel during a healthcare visit, including a medical emergency lies with the patient or the patient’s legal guardian.

As such, by using the Global Health Passport form, you release Global Health Passport, LLC from any legal liability arising from its usage, including but not limited to any current or future untoward consequences due to an omission, error, or miscommunication directly or indirectly arising as a result of having used the Global Health Passport formulary.

This document is being provided as is and Global Health Passport, LLC disclaims any warranty of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose in connection with your purchase and use of this document.
Global Health Passport is divided into three sections:
Fill out your Global Health Passport
Fill out all of Section I (Medical History).
Check mark (✓) all the boxes that apply to your medical history.
Fill out Section II (Current Medical Symptoms) if you are currently having medical symptoms or issues.
Check mark (✓) all the boxes that relate to your current medical symptoms or issues.
Fill out all of Section III (Current Dental Symptom) even if you are just having a dental check up or a dental cleaning.
Make sure that Section I has been completely filled out.
Have you had other foreign travel recently?
If YES, please list all countries of recent travel
Please list all countries which you will be visiting in the next few days/weeks/months
Use these phrases in a medical or dental emergency.
Please take me to the nearest hospital.
Please call a cab for me.
Please call the local 3-digit emergency phone number for me.
Please give me the 3-digit emergency phone number used here.
Please take me to a dentist’s office.
Please direct me to the nearest dentist.
This booklet contains my personal medical history.
Please use my medical information provided in this booklet.
My allergies are listed on page 9 of this booklet.
I don't speak the local language.
When was your last menstrual period?
Have you had any recent insect bites?
If yes, what type of insect?
Have you had a recent mosquito bite?
Blood in your urine, stools, or vomit
Bleeding from your nose or gums, or bleeding under the skin which may look like bruising
Do you only have one kidney?

Are you, your child, or the individual presenting today under your care allergic to iodine or seafood (shrimp), and/or have you or they had a bad or adverse reaction (such as a skin: rash, redness, or itching) and/or difficulty breathing or swallowing when you or they have had dye (iodinated contrast medium) previously injected intravenously during or immediately after a prior medical/radiologic procedure?
If yes, please list the type of reaction

Do you, your child, or this individual under your care need to receive or has ever previously received a premedication drug regimen prior to having a radiologic examination such as a CT Scan, or a kidney examination such as Intravenous Pyelography (IVP), or any other medical study utilizing dye (an iodinated contrast medium) injected intravenously due to a prior allergic response to the dye (injected iodinated contrast medium)?
Are you allergic to other antibiotic(s)?
Are you allergic to bee stings or other insect bites?
Surgery to your stomach, small intestines, or colon
Placement of brain aneurysmal clips for a prior brain aneurysm correction
Other brain or spinal cord surgery
Hysterectomy (surgical removal of the uterus), surgical removal of an ovary(ovaries), or fallopian tube(s)
Vasectomy, orchidectomy (surgical removal of a testicle), or prostatic surgery
Do you have an allergy to MRI contrast? MRI
Do you only have one kidney?
No, I still have both kidneys
Are you claustrophobic and/or have you previously experienced difficulties prior or during an MRI examination?
Do you have a cardiac pacemaker, or retained pacemaker leads in place?
Do you have a carotid sinus pacemaker in place?

Do you have a prosthetic heart valve, inferior vena cava filter, biliary or vascular stent, IUD (Intrauterine Device), or a metallic prosthesis in place, in which there is a doubt or concern as to positional stability?
Do you have an automatic implantable cardioverter defibrillator (AICD) in place?
Do you have an insulin pump in place?
Do you have a neurostimulator in place?
Do you have a non-graphite spinal cord tong in place?
Do you have a cochlear implant in place?
Do you have a stapedial implant in place?
Do you have a known metallic foreign body (metal sliver) in your eye, or have you ever been or are you currently a welder?
Do you have a brain aneurysmal clip from a prior surgery?
Do you have a Thermodilution Swan Ganz Catheter in place?
Do you have other possible surgical/or nonsurgical metal in or on your body such as a stainless steel spinal metallic device or devices?
Do you have an eyelid tattoo?
Do you have a history of hemophilia or other coagulation deficiency with an increased tendency to bleed?
If you have diabetes, are you on
If you have a history of diabetes, do you currently have?
Are you immunocompromised or are you currently receiving chemotherapy?
Do you have any of the following conditions?
A history of chronic dizziness or loss of balance
A history of neurological conditions such as Parkinson’s disease, multiple sclerosis, or Huntington’s chorea
Chronic moderate to severe sore throat
Do you have any of the following conditions?
Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia or other HIV related medical conditions.
Other Pulmonary Conditions Not Listed Above
Do you sleep with multiple pillows
Do you have foot or ankle swelling
Do you have History of a blood clotting disorder
Do you have any of the following conditions?
Prior history of irregular bowel movements with periods of constipation and/or diarrhea
History of visible blood after a bowel movement
History of peptic ulcers (esophageal, gastric, or duodenal ulcers)
Do you still have your appendix?
Do you only have one kidney?
No, I still have both kidneys
Do you have any of the following conditions?
Visible blood upon urination without pain
Cancer of the kidneys, ureters, or urinary bladder
Do you have any of the following conditions?
If yes, do you have pelvic pain or unusual chronic pelvic symptoms?
History of heavy menstrual flow or irregular menstrual periods
History of a spontaneous abortion of a pregnancy
History of an ectopic (outside of the uterus) pregnancy
History of current pain or bleeding related to pregnancy
Do you have any of the following conditions?
Do you have any of the following conditions?
Do you have any of the following conditions?
Melanoma or other form of skin cancer
A mole, wart, or other skin lesion that is enlarging or changing color

sections.title: PLEASE REVIEW ALL OF THE BODY SECTIONS BELOW AND CHECK MARK (✓) ALL THE BOXES THAT APPLY TO YOU.

George P. Ciporkin, D.D.S., M.D., the author of this potentially life saving series, brings years of training and clinical experience in both medicine and dentistry into the series’ design.
He received a Bachelor of Science degree from Duke University, a D.D.S. degree from Northwestern University, and an M.D. degree from The Medical College of Ohio in the United States.
He has traveled and lived abroad, and has formally studied several foreign languages.

The Global Health Passport gives the traveler peace of mind in knowing that he or she can quickly and easily convey personalized medical information abroad to healthcare personnel who are not fluent in the traveler’s native language. The series are designed to provide concise, but thorough medical information particularly for travelers who encounter a medical emergency abroad or who are engaged in medical tourism. Safe Travels!
